item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @Eson Eson
item.description:
@Eson wrote:

[quote=“X Entinity X, post:2, topic:371032”]If the commands are in the same method as PlayerRights 1, 2 or 3 then that’s your problem, or if you didn’t close your last method properly it can sometimes override it.[/quote] i tried it the playerrights 1 -2-3 way didn’t help

Read full topic

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @X_Entinity_X X Entinity X
item.description:
@X_Entinity_X wrote:

If the commands are in the same method as PlayerRights 1, 2 or 3 then that’s your problem, or if you didn’t close your last method properly it can sometimes override it.

Read full topic

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @Eson Eson
item.description:
@Eson wrote:

Okay ehm i have a noob problem xD , i want my ::master , ::pure and ::setlevel to be for normal players too , my code is ;

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master")) { if (c.inWild()) return; c.playerXP[0] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[0] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[0]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(0); c.playerXP[2] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[2] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[2]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(2); c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); c.playerXP[4] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[4] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[4]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(4); c.playerXP[5] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[6] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(5); c.playerXP[6] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[6] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(6); }
okay so if i compile log on and try if normal players can do ::master or ::pure or ::setlevel , they can’t!! can som1 help me pls???

Read full topic
